review.description:
4.5 stars!

This place is SO good and a welcome addition to the neighborhood.  The burgers are delicious, the drinks & beer are great, and the staff is incredibly friendly - what more could you ask for in a burger place?

If you're not in the mood for fries, I suggest sharing a plate of the nachos with whoever you're dining, they are fantastic.  Also, if you deny yourself the 282 sauce you are a crazy person.

I know a lot of the reviews talk about the size of the burgers here, and I swear the sizes of the burgers are getting bigger each time I go.

This is an awesome place to sit at the bar, grab a beer, and have a burger.  The staff and owner are really nice, and it doesn't hurt that the burgers are perfectly cooked.
review.author: Kathleen C.

review.description: Came here more than once. I had a crave today for a burger and didn't want just any burger. I am never disappointed!
review.author: Mary H.

review.description: I know there are many burger places in BKLYN to choose from (including Shake Shack) but this is my favorite. The burgers are delicious and made with meat from my favorite butchers. The grilled cheese is perfect as is the BLT. Greek Salad is large and fresh. Full bar to keep me liquored up! And any place that serves good onion rings is a winner with me. If they would just add a side salad to the menu it would be perfect.
review.author: Tammy J.

review.description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon and sat in their patio area, no wait at all. Their burgers are absolutely delicious! Service is very attentive and the price is very reasonable. I think I found my burger place, avoid the lines at Shake Shack and make your way here!
review.author: Je L.

review.description: This place has great burgers. The waiter suggested the new Hatch burger. It has a little spicy kick to it. It was a great suggestion. The Greek fries were very tasty. I would definitely recommend this place if your looking for a great burger.
review.author: Rachel B.

review.description: I've had all of them - Black Label burger at Minetta, Shack, Hubert Keller's place in Vegas, In & Out etc.  282 is my very favorite.  Their burger is well seared, always juicy.  The bun is perfectly buttered and warmed.  The poblano peppers are a great touch.  They have a great beer selection of beers.  Service is good and quick.  I travel to find a good burger.  But I don't know if I'll find one that I like more than 282's special blend of awesome.
review.author: J P.

review.description: We checked this place out for dinner while on a business trip and it did not disappoint.  I tried the 50/50 burger, which was quite simply the best burger i've ever had.  We shared the greek fries, and i'd recommend sharing since one order can easily fill 2 people.  My group also tried the breakfast burger, Billy Burger, and Turkey burger, and both parties who had the beef burgers said they were one of if not THE best burger they've ever had.  The turkey burger eater said it was good, but not "the best".  Needless to say the burgers were good enough that we walked back for lunch the next day.  HIGHLY Recommend this place.  They also have some great beers on tap, if you into that sort of thing :)
review.author: Michael G.

review.description:
Come eat here!

I love their burgers.  They're fresh and well cooked and just amazing.  (Hot dogs, maybe not so much).

The atmosphere is fantastic, service is great, and the beer/cocktail selection is better than any burger joint has a right to be.
review.author: Gordon W.

review.description: Very good Burgers, great sweet potato fries, and I nice staff.  Overall a very pleasant atmosphere.
review.author: Pat M.

review.description: One of the best tasting hamburgers I've ever had (and I am a bit of a burger snob). Bun could use some work but the burger makes it well worth the visit. I've had everything on their menu minus the grilled cheese. Everything is really tasty. Great BLT. Great hotdogs (a bit messy though). Good selection of beer. Great cocktails. Sometimes they can be a little grumpy but most good burger places I've been to are kind of like that (the grumpiness gets the burgers out quicker and better I think).
review.author: Adam F.

review.description: Billy Burger was 8 bites of drippy, cheesy,onion bliss. Staff was very friendly and attentive. One of NYC's best burgers for sure.
review.author: Scott S.

review.description: My wife says the "Breakfast Burger" was one of the best she's ever tasted.  The problem was I ordered it, not her, so I got to eat half of it.  Her turkey burger was delicious, but how can you compete with a burger that has bacon and a fried egg on it?  The decor was minimal and classy, and the service was friendly and helpful.  Have plans to stop by again and try the "Two 8 Two Burger."
review.author: Nicholas P.

review.description: The burgers are great. The pub burger will slay you. Everyone's very friendly. I deduct one star because the bartenders don't seem to do buybacks and as a loyal patron, I don't think that's too much to ask.
review.author: Jeremy E.

review.description: The service was awful. Received water and that's it,the waiter took our order and never received our food. Everyone else who ordered after us got their food and we just sat their looking foolish,maybe it was because we were the ONLY MINORITY table! Will NEVER recommend it to minorities.I never felt so disrespected and in my own country that I proudly served.
review.author: Pedro M.

review.description: Been here twice, the first time I got take-out and it was alright and I chalked it down to the fact that I did take-out and didn't sit and eat.  I went again, and again was underwhelmed.  Burger was juicy, but wasn't anything special.  Also had the greek fries, again they were flavorless.  Why is it so fucking hard to get a good burger in NY?
review.author: Taimur A.

review.description:
Based upon their ambience, my husband & I and company decided to try it out - We were pleasantly surprised & satisfied :-)!

Since their burger meats are purchased from Los Paisanos Meat Market, it can't go wrong with it.  The FAVORITE BURGER of the evening is the "Breakfast Burger".

The ambience is not too shabby, but for some, it can be considered a wee bit dark.  Personally, I don't mind it too much.

If anything, the only "negative" is the open kitchen aspect - By the time you leave the restaurant, you & your clothing items smell like burgers...:-|
review.author: Ada C.

review.description: Really good burgers. Really good. My kids each had seconds, that's unusual. And as we all know, kids are the origination of the finicky palate. Go here, you will enjoy it.
review.author: Michael C.

review.description: My boyfriend and I come here all of the time-it is probably our favorite burger spot in the neighborhood. I almost always get the billy burger and it never disappoints. Their special two8two sauce is amazing-I don't know what they put in it but we always ask for extra for our fries. The service is great here as well-very quick and all of the servers are really friendly. They also have a fun drink menu which is especially great during the summer when you can sit outside on their terrace. My only complaint about two8two is the way that your clothes smell after eating here. I don't know if we always get placed too close to the kitchen or what it is but we always come out smelling like the food. This will always be one of our fave spots though and we will continue to frequent it.
review.author: Molly H.

review.description: Solid burger, good ambiance, great service.  What is lacks in variety it makes up for in execution.  One star off because it is a little pricey and the menu is extremely limited. Otherwise, I'm a fan.
review.author: Michael B.

review.description: Great sweet potato fries, burgers, and beer. It's a really solid burger joint on Atlantic.
review.author: El D.
